item.title: Cool Shell Scripts I've Found Handy
item.description: This post is very messy and mostly made for testing code blocks. Vibe: I had used mpd and ncmpcpp for my music for a long time now, but decided to switch to mpv for the simplicity, and to make things even easier, I wrote this script, which shuffles all of the music files in the chosen directory and plays them in a terminal window, with album art in it’s own small, separate window.

item.title: Some of My Favorite Software
item.description: Just a list of some software I find nice to use: Software Description dash Fast and powerful POSIX shell giph Customizable and easy to use GIF recorder maim Extremely powerful CLI screenshot tool mpv Simple yet featureful CLI media player SXIV “Simple X Image Viewer” birch Freenode IRC client written in bash herbe Simple, yet DBus free notifications farge Simple Colorpicker written in bash ungoogled-chromium Browse safely and Google-free, no compromises ST Simple Terminal scr Super Crappy SCReenshot SCRipt for Sound Cloud Rappers vimtex Make LaTeX in Vim a breeze to edit ale A complete syntax checker and linter for Vim neovim Objectively the best editor shfm Terminal file browser written in posix shell KISS Linux An independent Linux Distro focused on simplicity cfm Simple and fast terminal file manager epy Terminal based Ebook reader PDF Viewer Plus The best mobile PDF viewer there is ripcord Not great, but it’s a minimal discord client doas Simple and light sudo replacement wpm Command line typing test monkey-type Clean, fun, and minimal typing test wmutils Very extensible set of WM utilities 0x0 Effective, No-Bullshit file hosting
